heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 21 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 12%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 977 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 53.0°C), dew point temperature (up 47.9°C), outside temperature (up 51.9°C), and cloud levels (up 595 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 976.6m lower than yesterday, 595.0m lower than the past week, 489.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1011m minimum and 4080m maximum, with an average of 1215.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1810.9m and 1705.2m.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and near calm conditions. Showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dim outside. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.
